event.title: was named UK town of the year in 2009

data.event: Richmond was named UK town of the year in 2009.
The Georgian Theatre Royal in Richmond, built in 1788, is the UK's most complete 18th century theatre.
Richmond was founded in 1071 by the Breton Alan Rufus, on lands granted to him by William the Conqueror.
Richmond Castle, completed in 1086, had a keep and walls encompassing the area now known as the Market Place.
